definition: a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
holy/sacred/saint/sage
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
Confuciusornis sanctus (Jurassic fossil bird)
holy book

sentences.english: To err is human and to forgive divine.
sentences.chinese: 人非圣贤孰能无过，宽恕为上。

sentences.english: Basically, "People are not sages; who can be without faults?"
sentences.chinese: 本来嘛，“人非圣贤，孰能无过？”

sentences.english: We all can gradually learn to become worthies and sages ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 只要奋发向上，人人都可以渐渐达到圣贤的境界。

sentences.english: Blame only themselves to blame "book, two sages heart read-only window his ears."
sentences.chinese: 怪只怪自己“一心只读圣贤书，两耳不闻窗外事。”

sentences.english: Yahoo knowledge together, Ding Bai into saints.
sentences.chinese: 雅虎知识堂，白丁成圣贤。

sentences.english: "Two outside the window, his ears heart read-only sages book" already do not apply.
sentences.chinese: “两耳不闻窗外事，一心只读圣贤书”已不适用。

sentences.english: The man is no saint, and his movement displays a whiff of Hindu chauvinism (see article).
sentences.chinese: 人非圣贤，这次运动带有印度沙文主义的色彩。

sentences.english: On the walls of this venerable shrine is written the precepts of the seven sages.
sentences.chinese: 在这座神圣的寺庙的墙壁上写着七位圣贤的箴言。
人非圣贤，安能无所不知。

sentences.english: For in earth is the balm of Nature, and the salt of the Sages.
sentences.chinese: 在地球是万金油的性质和盐的圣贤。

sentences.english: Unless they are proper books written by sages, we should avoid reading them.
sentences.chinese: 若非圣贤所传述的正经书，一定摒弃不看。

sentences.english: Google is the oracle of redirection.
sentences.chinese: Google是能让人们转向的圣贤。

sentences.english: Is there a contradiction between reading sacred books and looking for the way of immortality?
sentences.chinese: 读圣贤书，而求神仙不死之道，其间是否矛盾？

sentences.english: The sages of ancient times taught us to render good for evil.
sentences.chinese: 古代圣贤教导我们要以德报怨。

definition: saint/sage/refers to Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]/the current reigning Emperor
distinguished precursor/famous thinker of antiquity
worthy predecessor/distinguished person of the past/former sage
Confucius and Mencius
sage
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
great person of the past/venerable forebear/the great and the good
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
Confucian
the Sage Confucius
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
holy book
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Confucianism
to regulate the family and rule the state (idiom)
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
